main event: Six yellow-orange objects were observed flying due south over Toledo, Ohio on October 23, 1952.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be standing still at times, which left some doubt as to whether they were conventional aircraft.
The objects moved rapidly, flying from horizon to horizon directly over the heads of the observers.
The objects changed formation from one large 'V' to two 'V' formations of three objects each.
The observer took a series of five color slides of the objects, which showed the objects to be trailing fire.
The total observation time was estimated to be 15 minutes.
photographs: Yes, the report includes five color slides
